title: The Hubble Deep Field
description: A quick, practical guide to The Hubble Deep Field.

hook.text: In 1995, Hubble pointed at an empty patch of sky for ten days. What it found rewrote our understanding of the universe.

buildup.text: Scientists aimed the telescope at a speck of sky the size of a grain of sand held at arm's length.

discovery.text: The image revealed over 3,000 galaxies â€” each containing billions of stars. In one tiny patch of 'nothing.'

twist.text: The observation was controversial. Critics said it wasted expensive telescope time staring at blank sky.

climax.text: The Hubble Deep Field became one of the most important images in science. Emptiness was full of galaxies.

punchline.text: They pointed at nothing and found everything.

quiz.question: What did the Hubble Deep Field image reveal?
options: Thousands of previously unseen galaxies in a tiny patch of sky
